page.title: 14A FARM IN BARKSTON ASH
page.content: {Ivy Hall farm}is{arable}and situated in the middle of Barkston Ash.The farm house was built around 1775,and one of its barns in 1750.Mr Brogden owns 210 acres,but 50 are rented to other farmers. The soil is limestone and has good drainage. The crops grown are wheat,barley, oats and sugar beet. The farmer owns 4 donkeys,4 cats and 1 dog. He has 2 ploughs,1 rotavator,2 tractors,2 seed drills,2 trailers and 1 combine harvester. Mr Brogden does most of the work. When the sugar beet needs harvesting he hires somebody.He also hires somebody to drive a tractor while he drives the combine harvester. Barley to Tadcaster brewery, sugar beet to BSC, wheat+oats animal fodder.
